com.bigdata.ganglia.xdr

Class XDROutputBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.ganglia.xdr.XDROutputBuffer

  • public class XDROutputBuffer
extends Object
    A class for writing XDR data onto an internal buffer.
    See Also:
    RDF 4506

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XDROutputBuffer(int BUFFER_SIZE) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getBuffer()
      Return the backing byte[] buffer.
      int getLength()
      Return the #of bytes written onto the buffer.
      void reset()
      Reset the buffer (clears the offset of the next byte to be written to zero).
      void writeDouble(double d)
      Puts a double into the buffer as 8 bytes, big-endian.
      void writeFloat(float f)
      Puts a float into the buffer as 4 bytes, big-endian.
      void writeInt(int i)
      Puts an integer into the buffer as 4 bytes, big-endian.
      void writeLong(long i)
      Puts a long into the buffer as 8 bytes, big-endian.
      void writeShort(short i)
      Puts a short integer into the buffer as 2 bytes, big-endian but w/ leading zeros (e.g., as if an int32 value).
      void writeString(String s)
      Puts a string into the buffer by first writing the size of the string as an int, followed by the bytes of the string, padded if necessary to a multiple of 4.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • XDROutputBuffer

        public XDROutputBuffer(int BUFFER_SIZE)
        Parameters:
        BUFFER_SIZE - The size of the fixed capacity buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the buffer (clears the offset of the next byte to be written to zero).

      • getBuffer

        public byte[] getBuffer()
        Return the backing byte[] buffer.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Return the #of bytes written onto the buffer.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(String s)
        Puts a string into the buffer by first writing the size of the string as an int, followed by the bytes of the string, padded if necessary to a multiple of 4.

      • writeShort

        public void writeShort(short i)
        Puts a short integer into the buffer as 2 bytes, big-endian but w/ leading zeros (e.g., as if an int32 value). This is based on looking at ganglia data as received on the wire. For example, cpu_num is reported as ushort.

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int i)
        Puts an integer into the buffer as 4 bytes, big-endian.

      • writeLong

        public void writeLong(long i)
        Puts a long into the buffer as 8 bytes, big-endian.

      • writeFloat

        public void writeFloat(float f)
        Puts a float into the buffer as 4 bytes, big-endian.

      • writeDouble

        public void writeDouble(double d)
        Puts a double into the buffer as 8 bytes, big-endian.
